column4: hi, why do these messages keep coming up in my /var/log/auth.log, even if i didn't sudo ? http://pastebin.com/m54e212a8
those messages show when you login as root on your local machine
auth.log tracks samba logins and pam logins
i don't have samba. what are pam logins ?
pam is what you use to login to your ubuntu session
if you didn't make that login , IE through a terminal window, then some program must have root access to login ..perhaps a script, but a user and only a user should know what runs on the machine
ok - this is strange, there are lots of these mesagges, but when i try to grep the process via ps aux, it shows nothing. there are several pid's and i tried a lot of them
you will not find the PID for it, because it opens and closes to fast
allright, but what is the explanation ?
if your worried do a who -a and kill any root sessions that are active.
no root session is open.. i'm worried because yesterday some guy tried to break in via ssh. and now there are lots of root logins i don't understand..
is there any secure option to check for backdoors, etc ?
make sure you have a strong password other than that you need a strong firewall, there will always be people that lurk in the broadcast ranges of ISP's
you could make sure you have ufw installed
it's installed, but doesn't seem to run oO
ufw status will tell you
i did sudo ufw enable and it shows this: http://pastebin.com/m55dfe7f9
try again
do ufw status first
ufw status said it was disabled
yea thats not good. enableing will good
i did that and this was the output: http://pastebin.com/m55dfe7f9
